com.mapgroup.classificator.boundary

Class MultiServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapgroup.classificator.boundary.MultiServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

     class MultiServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents all the main server capabilities.  The server grant the possibility to the user to learn Decision tree from a specified dataset.

    The server, using the multi-threading Java libraries, is able to manage multiple clients in the same moment and grants to them to ask for the services that has at its disposal.

    Other important functionality that the server grant to the user are:

    • Report of the predicition session in pdf format
    • Upload of specific dataset in different format (txt,arff,xls)
    • Mail sending to multiple addressees with attachments
    • Dataset creation and manipulation from the supported dataset format

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  MultiServer.ServeOneClient
      This class contains all the functionality to manage the request of a single client

      specific model for the clientArea which defines its structure
      private javax.swing.JTextArea logArea
      graphical panel which contains all the detail about the operation that the server does during its activity

      the main server socket

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiServer(int port)
      MultiServer constructor which loads the server on the specified port and create its graphical interface.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void addClient(java.net.Socket s)
      Adds the specified client information to the clientArea The client's information will be shown following the format returned by the getSocketInfo(java.net.Socket) method
      private void closeSocket()
      Closes the communication with the client socket represented by closingSocket
      private java.lang.String getSocketInfo(java.net.Socket s)
      Returns a string which represents the information about the client formatted using the format: #HOSTNAME:#LOCAL_PORT(#PORT)
      private void initAndShowGUI()
      Initializes and creates the graphical interface for the main panel of the server on which will be displayed all the operation that the clients will do.
      private void removeClient(java.net.Socket s)
      Removes the information about the specified client from the clientArea
      void run()
      Starts the process with which the server's graphical interface was initialized and grant to it to wait until some clients ask to him something.
